cheatsheet.title: Deployment of Kermeta code in Eclipse GUI

intro.description:
This cheatsheet introduces the code needed to deploy a Kermeta code for a end user.
It will use the interpreter as sample.

item.title: fr.irisa.triskell.kmlogo.ui project
item.description: This plugin project contains the eclipse extension and the code that allows to launch a kermeta program from Eclipse GUI. This allows to hide to the end user in which language the transformation is written.

item.title: plugin extension
item.description:
Have a look to the popupMenus extension.
They declares the actions for the end user.

item.title: fr.irisa.triskell.kmlogo.ui.popup.actions.RunLogo.java
item.description: This is the code to call the Logo interpreter (the operational behavior we've defined for it)

subitem.label: Have a look at its content

item.title: fr.irisa.triskell.kmlogo.ui.RunLogoK.java
item.description:
This code calls Kermeta interpreter with a given kermeta program and parameters.
be careful in addition to initializing the interpreter, this code also sets the correct java classpath. Otherwise, Kermeta interpreter will not correctly find the java code called via the "extern".
